content.description:
Starts up diagonal crack splitting face, up and left of Star Wars.P1 Climb crack, to it's end, and gear belay (15m. 5.9). P2 follow short finger crack dihedral onto face, and follow knobs, and bolts (11) to bolted anchor that shares P2 of Star Wars (40m 5.11a) . Continue on P3 of Star Wars, or Rap (60m) to base. Excellent technical climbing. 20 m. left of P1 Star Wars. Look for obvious crack splitting low angle face, leading to steep splitter going right. Cams, very small to 2", also, extra finger size for gear belay.
2 x 60 m ropes.

A good climb that follows gains obvious cracks features at right of wall, seen from the base. P1/2 gains gear belay for P3, short technical crack, then exciting bolted dike traverse to base of headwall.(5.10) P4 shorter pitch (30m) follows cracks, and good face climbing past bolts(3) to cedars, and base of huge crack feature rising straight up.(5.10) P5 climbs crack/flake to it's end, bolt, and downclimb right to small dihedaral, up this to bolts, and traverse right to belay @ base of rf corner.(5.9) P6 up corner to crack splitting face, and traverse right past bolt to gear belay.(5.8) P7 follows obvious crack to ledge, and gear belay.(5.8) P8 rf corner to top/ tree rap. Follow bolted rap anchors to base. (5 raps) Trail along base of wall to far right.
Obvious clean crack @ start. Double set cams to #4 camalot. Triples in hand size.
2 60m ropes.
Double ropes recommended

Follow Obvious left facing dihedral to vertical crack system seen from base of wall where tail ends. After technical cracks, follow obvious weakness (5th class) to alcove. From alcove head right, through chimney and up to obvious "finish fins" No fixed anchors on route, all gear belays. To descend(rap), see topo. From where trail ends, gain small tree ledge up, and right.(flagged) Belay p.1 from this ledge. Double set of cams to 4", nuts.
2 x 60m ropes.

Awesome climb!! Short section of bolt protected 10+. Follows cracks, flakes, dikes, knobs, for 5 pitches to tree Island. P.1 is obvious left trending finger crack across face(10a). P.2 technical face climbing on knobs(10d). P.3 follows flake to face, bolt,and right to crack. Up this to belay(10a). P.4 follows dikes up and left to crack splitting face seen from below.(.9) P.5 obvious crack to tree island(.8) Move belay left to base of huge dihedral, climb it to it's end, and gear belay(.8)P.7 left across face (bolts) to crack, and up to ledge(10a). P.8 follows horizontal crack right for 55m(.9). P.9 Short crack to summit(.8) For Descent "hike" up, and right, and back down to rap route (see topo) From end of approach trail @ base, head right for 80m to large downed tree. P1 is the obvious left trending crack across face. Double set of cams to 3", stoppers.
2 x 60m ropes.
Pitches 1 to 4, and p8 have bolted belay anchors.

climbs.name: Three the hard way.
climbs.fa: D. Treadwell, J. Dunkley, A. Durie

content.description:
Three individual pitches, 30m. each. All share the same top anchor. Two dihedral cracks, and one finger crack that splits face at right. Anchors provide TR potential for five lines. On trail leading to right side off wall, look for obvious crack, splitting low angle face.
Further left, two left facing dihedrals. Small rack to 2"
Dihedrals lead to two bolts across face to top anchor.(bolts)

Located in the upper "Lois Valley", just past Khartoum lake. With Mt. Diadem at the head of valley. 
 "Khartoum" holds several(3) multipitch climbs from 7 to 10 pitches in length. As well as several shorter routes of 1 to 3 pitches. 
 Rock is good, and very clean, by coastal B.C. standards. 
 Routes are "moderate" (5.7 to 5.10), and involve extensive crack systems, interspersed with technical face climbing. 
 The wall faces East, and has afternoon shade in summer months.
